flags_by_paragraph.text_excerpt: This confidentiality agreement (the 'Agreement') is entered into between ('Partner') and, (the 'Company').
green_flags: Standard introductory clause setting out parties to the agreement

flags_by_paragraph.text_excerpt: Confidential Information shall be deemed to be, by way of example and without limitation, any information of a technical, financial, commercial or any other nature
green_flags: Detailed and comprehensive definition of confidential information

flags_by_paragraph.text_excerpt: Both Parties undertake to maintain, for the time provided for in this Agreement, in the strictest confidence and not to disclose the Confidential Information
This Agreement shall enter into force on the day of the last of the signatures at the end of the Agreement and shall remain in force until...
yellow_flags: Lengthy duration of confidentiality obligations, could be restrictive

flags_by_paragraph.text_excerpt: During the term of this Agreement... the Receiving Party shall not, under any circumstances, design, develop, market or...
red_flags: Very lengthy non-compete clause, could be restrictive and unenforceable

flags_by_paragraph.text_excerpt: The Parties acknowledge that a breach of the obligations set out in this Agreement may cause irreparable damage to the other Party...
yellow_flags: Unclear on the quantification of 'irreparable damage'

flags_by_paragraph.text_excerpt: This Agreement shall be governed by German law...
red_flags: Jurisdiction clause could potentially disadvantage one party, depending on their geographical location

overall_summary: This Non-Disclosure Agreement contains standard clauses such as the definition of Confidential Information and the confidentiality obligations of the Parties. However, it also includes a potentially restrictive non-compete clause and a term clause with lengthy confidentiality obligations. The jurisdiction clause could potentially disadvantage one party.
recommendation: Consider amendments to the term, non-competition and jurisdiction clauses to be more favourable for the client. Assess the client's risk tolerance level for the highlighted yellow and red flags before proceeding
